Members of a Dalit political party said that she would be punished.

176.title: Bengaluru doctor posts fiancee's nude pics on social media, killed; 3 arrested
176.article_body: Bengaluru Police have arrested a 27-year-old architect, Prathibha, and her two male friends on charges of murdering her live-in partner and fiance, Dr N Vikas, for allegedly uploading her nude photos on social media. Police said Prathibha found that Vikas uploaded photos of her and her mother using a fake ID. Police said Dr Vikas worked at a private hospital.

177.title: BJP, PM don't need validation from Mamata: Amit Malviya
177.article_body: Reacting to Mamata Banerjee's statement that she does not believe that PM Narendra Modi is misusing central agencies, BJP IT Cell head Amit Malviya said that no one in BJP, and most certainly the PM, needs any validation from her. "Her entire govt, top ministers...immediate family is under the radar of central agencies, because the courts ordered investigation," he added.

178.title: 38-yr-old Mumbai man held for stealing 27 bicycles worth ₹2.6 lakh
178.article_body:
A 38-year-old resident of Dharavi, Raes Tavar Khan, has been arrested for allegedly stealing 27 bicycles worth ₹2.6 lakh from Mumbai's Bandra, Khar, Shivaji Park and Lamington Road areas.
"We intercepted Khan as we found his movements to be suspicious," police said. "We suspect...some of the stolen bicycles belong to...Dabbawalas, who are an integral part of the city," police added.

179.title: PepsiCo ends Pepsi, 7UP and Mountain Dew production in Russia
179.article_body: PepsiCo has stopped producing Pepsi, 7UP and Mountain Dew in Russia nearly six months after it said it would suspend sales and production over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "All concentrates have subsequently been exhausted in Russia and production has ended," a PepsiCo spokesperson said. The spokesperson added that this was "in line with the announcement we made in March".

180.title: Matrimonial ad asks software engineers to 'not call'; social media users react
180.article_body: After a matrimonial ad asked software engineers to "not call", a Twitter user wrote, "Can Mechanical engineers call." Sharing the undated newspaper ad, the founder of Helios Capital, Samir Arora wrote, "Future of IT does not look so sound." "Don't worry...Engineers don't rely on some newspaper ad. They find everything on their own," another user wrote.

181.title: Ranbir & I are not 'two bodies one soul' kind of people: Alia Bhatt
181.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has said that she and her husband Ranbir Kapoor are strong individuals. "We both respect our individual personalities and professional commitments together. We're not do jism ek jaan (two bodies one soul) kind of people," she added. Alia stated they have a "beautiful" relationship as companions and have a better working relationship as they're passionate about films.

182.title: Assam passes Bill with penal provisions for pvt educational institutions
182.article_body: Assam Legislative Assembly on Monday passed the Assam Non-Government Educational Institutions (Regulation of Fees) (Amendment) Bill, 2022. The Bill includes penal measures against private institutions that do not comply with the provisions of the Fee Regulation Act. The non-government educational institutions have been asked to file applications before the Fee Regulatory Committee by October 31.

183.title: Man flashes his private part at minor girl in Navi Mumbai; booked
183.article_body: Police have booked an unidentified person for allegedly flashing his private part at a girl while asking for an address in Navi Mumbai's Vashi. According to police, the accused man had also offered her to sit on his motorbike to help him in locating the address, which the girl refused. "We...are checking the CCTV footage...to trace the accused," police said.

184.title: Don’t fall prey to fake website selling plots near Noida airport: YEIDA
184.article_body: A fake website called yamunaawasiyabhukhand.in is allegedly offering residential plots near the Noida airport site, Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) CEO Arunvir Singh has warned in a notice. The website is misusing YEIDA's main project details and its master plan. It reportedly pretends to provide inexpensive apartments close to the airport to deceive unwary investors.

185.title: Environmentalist dies by suicide over corruption in PDS in K'taka
185.article_body: A 68-year-old environmentalist allegedly died by suicide over corruption in Public Distribution System (PDS) in Karnataka's Davanagere district on Tuesday. Veerachari had earlier claimed that food items in PDS shops were not being distributed to marginalised sections of society and pledged to end his life if justice wasn't delivered. Following the incident, local residents staged a protest.

186.title: Israel appoints ambassador to Turkey for first time since 2018
186.article_body: Israel on Monday announced the appointment of Irit Lillian as its new ambassador to Turkey. Lillian is the first person to hold the post since 2018. Turkey withdrew its ambassador from Israel and ordered Israel's ambassador to leave the country in 2018 over the killing of dozens of Palestinians by Israeli forces during border protests along the Gaza border.

187.title: Sub-contractor detained after boundary wall collapse in Noida kills 4
187.article_body: Hours after a portion of a Noida housing society's boundary wall collapsed on Tuesday, police have detained the sub-contractor who supplied labourers for repairing a drain there. Eight people were injured in the incident that took place at Jal Vayu Vihar in Noida Sector 21. All 12 labourers were buried under the rubble.

188.title: He needs to improve: Indian men's wrestling coach on Ravi's World C'ships loss
188.article_body: Indian men's wrestling coach Sujeet Maan said that Ravi Dahiya needs to improve after the Olympic silver medallist's loss to Uzbekistan's Gulomjon Abdullaev in the 57-kg category pre-quarterfinal at the recently concluded World Wrestling Championships. "He (Ravi) knows he has to improve and there is certainly no one more disappointed with his performance than he himself is," he added.

189.title: CPI MP writes to President, says 'Kerala Governor's actions unconstitutional'
189.article_body: CPI MP Binoy Viswam has written a letter to President Droupadi Murmu accusing the Kerala Governor of having an open collision with the state government and called his actions anti-constitutional. "The Governor has stated that he was not inclined to give assent to the bills passed by the Assembly...He is sworn to preserve, protect and defend the Constitution," said Viswam.

190.title: T'gana man stabbed with injection after offering lift to stranger; dies later
190.article_body: A 46-year-old man in Telangana's Khammam died on Monday after an unidentified man allegedly stabbed him with an injection after seeking a lift on the deceased's two-wheeler. The suspect escaped from the scene after administering the injection, police said. The deceased sought help from people nearby, complaining of giddiness. He soon fainted and was taken to a hospital.

191.title: Over 40 lakes disappeared in Bengaluru since 1963: Karnataka minister
191.article_body: During a debate about floods in Karnataka, state Revenue Minister R Ashoka told the Karnataka Assembly that over 40 lakes have disappeared in Bengaluru since 1963. Buildings and layouts have been built on levelled lakes in areas like Rajajinagar and Dollars Colony, he added. He alleged that most of the encroachments on lakes happened during the tenure of Congress government.

192.title: Building collapses, fire incidents are major concern in cities: PM
192.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said the collapse of old buildings and incidents of buildings catching fire in cities are a major concern. "This can be avoided if rules are followed," he added while addressing BJP mayors' conference. His remarks come on a day when a building wall in a Noida residential complex came down, killing four workers.

193.title: 4 nations including Poland turn away Russian tourists over Ukraine war
193.article_body: Poland, Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania have begun turning away Russian tourists, saying they should not enter while their country is at war with Ukraine. Finland has reduced consular appointments for Russian travellers seeking visas. The ban excludes Russian dissidents seeking refuge. The European Union has banned all flights from Russia, keeping only rail and road transport links operational.

194.title: IIT Bombay girl student filmed inside hostel bathroom by canteen worker
194.article_body: A canteen worker at IIT Bombay was arrested for recording a video of a girl student while she was in the hostel bathroom, students of the institute have alleged. The student noticed the accused's phone looming outside the bathroom window, filming her, and alerted the hostel council and authorities. The worker had allegedly climbed pipes to peep inside the bathroom.

195.title: Stopped from making reels, UP woman tries to strangle her brothers
195.article_body: Police have registered a case against a young woman after she attempted to strangulate her two younger brothers when they stopped her from making video reels in UP's Farrukhabad, according to a report. She even allegedly assaulted women police constables and tore their uniform. Her brother reportedly said she had an addiction of making reels and uploading them on Instagram.

196.title: Bridge left twisted, cracked after strong earthquake in Taiwan; video surfaces
196.article_body: A strong 6.8 magnitude earthquake that hit southeastern Taiwan on Sunday left the Gaoliao Bridge twisted and cracked. Since Saturday evening, dozens of earthquakes have hit the island's southeastern coast. The earthquakes also toppled a three-story building and knocked a part of a passenger train off its tracks.

197.title: Jet Airways warns job applicants of fake interviews, issues statement
197.article_body: Ahead of its relaunch, Jet Airways issued a statement in reference to its job applications. The airline said that some people impersonating Jet Airways employees are demanding money in exchange for interviews or jobs at the airline. "Jet Airways does not solicit any payment for any recruitment," it added. It further asked applicants to check the source of job postings.

198.title: 31 students fall sick after eating dinner at Telangana school
198.article_body: As many as 31 students fell sick after eating dinner at a minority residential school in Telangana's Kumuram Bheem Asifabad district on Monday. They were rushed to a hospital, where their condition was said to be stable. Some students complained that they were getting low-quality food for the past three days and that they even found insects in the food.

199.title: Cash crunch due to wrong vastu, will shut Hyd Bus Bhavan south gate: TSRTC
199.article_body: Authorities of Telangana State Road Transport Corporation said the corporation faced financial loss possibly due to wrong vastu alignment. Accordingly, they're planning to shut the south entry gate of Hyderabad's Bus Bhavan and open an east-facing gate that they believe "aligns well with vastu shastra and will bring better luck". The east symbolises life and brings light, an official said.

200.title: Rana Daggubati snatches fan's phone over selfie at Tirupati temple
200.article_body: Actor Rana Daggubati recently visited the Tirupati temple along with his wife Miheeka Bajaj and his father D Suresh Babu. A video going viral on social media shows a fan trying to pose with Rana for a selfie when Rana snatches his phone. The actor can then be seen returning the fan's phone and saying, "No selfies in a temple."

201.title: 2 tribal women tonsured after panchayat finds them guilty of abetting suicide
201.article_body: A panchayat in Telangana's Nalgonda allegedly forcefully tonsured two tribal women after charging them with abetting the suicide of a 16-year-old of the same community. The two women were tied to a tree, reportedly abused and beaten up by villagers on Saturday, police officials said. The panchayat allegedly issued a diktat that police shouldn't be informed about the incident.

202.title: PFI leader arrested over RSS worker's murder in Kerala
202.article_body: A PFI leader, Aboobaker Siddik, has been arrested for killing an RSS worker in Kerala’s Palakkad district. He was apprehended on Monday for allegedly conspiring and hiding the culprits involved in the murder. "He is the 23rd accused in the Srinivasan murder case who has been arrested...He was taken into custody from his house," said the investigating officer.

203.title: 2 killed, 3 injured after lightning strikes shop in Chhattisgarh
203.article_body: Two men died and three other people were injured after lightning struck them in Chhattisgarh's Surajpur district on Monday evening. According to a police official, the deceased, identified as Nandlal Paikra and Sanjay Yadav, had taken shelter at a shop below a tree after it started raining. Suddenly lightning struck there, killing Paikra and Yadav on the spot, he added.

204.title: Ex-Meta executives' startup TrueFoundry raises $2.3 mn in seed round
204.article_body: US-based machine learning startup TrueFoundry has secured $2.3 million in a seed funding round led by Sequoia India and Surge. AngelList Talent Co-founder Naval Ravikant and Eniac Ventures participated in the round. TrueFoundry was co-founded by ex-Meta executives Nikunj Bajaj, Abhishek Choudhary and angel investor Anuraag Gutgutia. Angel investors include Deutsche India CEO, Dilip Khandelwal.

205.title: Auto driver, 4 others arrested for robbing 2 men at knifepoint in Mumbai
205.article_body: The Kurar Police arrested an auto driver and four others for allegedly robbing two men at knifepoint in Malad East, Mumbai. The accused were identified as Akash Shinde, Ganesh Anil Raje, Mahesh Kamble, Sunny Ghode and Ram Raje. The victims, Deenbandhu Das and Kallan Dulai, were waiting to hire an auto outside a restaurant when the incident happened, police said.

206.title: Have directed strict action: Thakur on players being served food kept in toilet
206.article_body: Reacting to the video of food kept in a toilet being served to kabaddi players in UP's Saharanpur, Union Sports Minister Anurag Thakur said that he has directed strict action against the accused contractor and officers. "I have also directed that the contractor be blacklisted for the future," he added. The district sports officer was suspended after the incident.

207.title: UK-US trade deal could be years away: British PM Liz Truss
207.article_body: The UK may not strike a free trade deal with the US for years, British PM Liz Truss said ahead of her first bilateral meeting with US President Joe Biden in New York. Truss said she was more focused on obtaining accession to the Trans-Pacific trade partnership and striking trade deals with India and the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC).

208.title: Maroon 5's Adam Levine accused of cheating on wife, Instagram model shares alleged DMs
208.article_body: 'Maroon 5' singer Adam Levine has been accused of cheating on his wife Behati Prinsloo by an Instagram influencer. Sumner Stroh released a TikTok video alleging she and Levine were having an affair. She shared screenshots of DMs allegedly from Levine, where they appeared to flirt, and a text from him asking if he could name his child after her.

209.title: Delhi HC proceeds ex-parte against Vivek Agnihotri in 2018 contempt case
209.article_body: Delhi High Court on Monday proceeded ex-parte against filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri, scientist Anand Ranganathan, and magazine and news portal Swarajya in connection with a 2018 contempt case. This comes after the three failed to appear or send their representatives to court. The case was filed over their criticism of Justice S Muralidhar for granting bail to Urban Naxal Gautam Navlakha.

210.title: Two drunk Army men create ruckus at Bengaluru airport, arrested
210.article_body: Two Army men were arrested for allegedly assaulting on-duty security personnel at Bengaluru airport in an inebriated condition, reports said. The accused were trying to drive in a lane designated for VIPs and CISF personnel when they were stopped, reports added. They were attending a party near Bengaluru and went to the airport to sober up, reports further said.

211.title: Tiger Global-backed Zopper raises $75 mn in Series C funding round
211.article_body: Insurtech startup Zopper on Tuesday said it has raised $75 million in a Series C funding round led by Creaegis, which also saw participation from ICICI Venture and Bessemer Venture Partners, and existing investor Blume Ventures. Co-founded by Surjendu Kuila and Mayank Gupta in 2011, the company said that Tiger Global will continue to extend its support for future growth.

212.title: Alia Bhatt receives Smita Patil Memorial Award for Best Actor
212.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has been felicitated with Priyadarshni Academy's Smita Patil Memorial Award for Best Actor. She was felicitated virtually by Union Ministers on Monday for her "outstanding and critically acclaimed performances in Hindi films". "India has the most incredible legacy of the arts and I'm eternally grateful that our work is a part of it," the actress said.

213.title: Very excited: Anees Bazmee on his action-comedy after 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2'
213.article_body: Director Anees Bazmee on Tuesday announced that he will be helming a "larger-than-life" action-comedy, which he promises to be a film that "the Indian audiences have never seen before". "After the success of 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2', I want to give our audiences an even bigger dose of entertainment," he said, adding that he's "very excited" about the upcoming project.

214.title: Water supply to be affected in parts of Thane on Wednesday
214.article_body: The Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) announced that a 12-hour water cut will be enforced in some parts of Thane on Wednesday (September 21). The water supply will be cut from 9 am to 9 pm to carry out maintenance work at Pise filtration plant. The strainer at the plant is clogged with silt and garbage after being flooded, TMC said.

215.title: Who are the most expensive buys of the first-ever SA20 auction?
215.article_body: Batter Tristan Stubbs is the most expensive buy of the first-ever SA20 auction, being bought by Sunrisers Eastern Cape for Rand 9.2 million. Batter Rilee Rossouw, bought by Pretoria Capitals for Rand 6.9 million, is the second-most expensive buy. He is followed by Marco Jansen (Sunrisers Eastern Cape, Rand 6.1 million) and Wayne Parnell (Pretoria Capitals, Rand 5.6 million)

216.title: Never date 2 boys at same time: Gauri on her dating advice to Suhana
216.article_body: Talking about the dating advice she would give her daughter Suhana Khan, Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan said, "Never date two boys at the same time." Gauri made this remark during her appearance on 'Koffee With Karan 7'. Discussing the film title she would use to describe her love story with SRK, Gauri stated, "Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge".

217.title: BYJU'S financial results 2nd blockbuster release of 2022 after Brahmāstra: Co-founder
217.article_body: BYJU'S Co-founder Divya Gokulnath claimed the edtech startup's financial results are "second blockbuster release" of 2022, after Brahmāstra. BYJU'S, which reported its results after 18-month delay, said losses for FY21 stood at ₹4,500 crore. Accusing media of "sensationalism", Gokulnath said, "It's easy [to] forget...we're 18 months post FY21, and...BYJU'S has grown over 4 times in this span."

218.title: Porn videos of young girls being sold on Twitter for ₹20: DCW chief Swati Maliwal
218.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women's Chairperson Swati Maliwal has claimed that porn videos of young girls are being sold on Twitter for ₹20-30. She tweeted, "Twitter has become a medium for selling pornographic videos of children. Videos of rape of young girls are flooded on Twitter." She said she has summoned Twitter India policy head and Delhi Police over the issue.

219.title: Officer suspended after Kabaddi players served food kept in toilet
219.article_body: A district sports officer in UP's Saharanpur, Animesh Saxena, has been suspended after reports of food kept in a toilet being served to Kabaddi players surfaced. The players had claimed that they were given half-cooked rice for lunch and when they complained, the cook placed rice in the toilet. A probe was ordered into the incident by the state government.

220.title: Deepika Padukone should play Amrita in Brahmāstra 2: Alia Bhatt
220.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said that she sees Deepika Padukone as the character Amrita in 'Brahmāstra: Part Two – Dev'. "She is gorgeous and stunning. She has that amazing stature," Alia added. Actor Ranbir Kapoor stated that Dev and Amrita are the most interesting characters in the trilogy, adding that it will be exciting for any actor to play the characters.

221.title: Huge BJP protest in Jaipur after over 50,000 cows died due to lumpy skin disease in Raj
221.article_body: The Bharatiya Janata Party on Tuesday staged a protest in Jaipur in connection with lumpy skin disease that has killed over 50,000 cattle in Rajasthan. Reports said the protestors clashed with police and broke barricades. They also raised slogans. Meanwhile, a BJP legislator, on Monday, brought a cow outside state Assembly to draw government attention towards the disease.

222.title: Prime suspect in TMC leader Bhadu Sheikh’s murder arrested by CBI
222.article_body: The CBI has arrested Sona Sheikh, who is one of the key suspects in TMC leader Bhadu Sheikh’s murder. He was arrested from Suri town in Birbhum and has been sent to CBI custody for four days. Earlier in March, a mob allegedly comprised of Bhadu’s associates had set 10 houses on fire, killing eight, including women and children.

223.title: Leaving out Pant in T20 WC 2022 will be the best thing: Wasim Jaffer
223.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said leaving out Rishabh Pant in the T20 World Cup 2022 will be the "best thing". Jaffer added that Pant's best role in the lineup would be that of an opener which he doesn't consider as a viable option. Jaffer stated that India should leave out Pant and pick Dinesh Karthik and Axar Patel instead.

224.title: Indonesia passes data privacy law that punishes leaks with 6-year jail term
224.article_body: Indonesian Parliament has passed a data protection bill that includes corporate fines and up to six years of imprisonment for those found mishandling data. The bill has been passed after data leaks and alleged breaches like a contact-tracing COVID-19 application that revealed President Joko Widodo's vaccine records. The fine includes 2% of a corporation's annual revenue and confiscation of assets.

225.title: DMK Deputy General Secretary Subbulakshmi Jagadeesan quits politics
225.article_body: Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) Deputy General Secretary Subbulakshmi Jagadeesan on Tuesday announced her resignation from the party and also from politics. "I submitted my resignation to party president MK Stalin on August 29. I am quitting the DMK and also from active politics," she said. Jagadeesan was Union Minister of State for Social Justice and Empowerment from 2004 to 2009.

226.title: Tunisia's anti-terrorism police detain former PM Laarayedh: Lawyers
226.article_body: Tunisia's anti-terrorism police have detained former Prime Minister and Opposition party Ennahda's senior official Ali Laarayedh for one day, lawyers said. According to lawyers, Laarayedh was detained after an investigation into suspicions of sending terrorists to Syria. Ennahda has denied accusations of terrorism, calling it a political attack on Tunisian President Kais Saied's foe.

227.title: Don't touch foreigners: Chinese official advice to avoid monkeypox
227.article_body: A top Chinese health official has warned citizens against touching foreigners and recent returnees from abroad after mainland China confirmed its first case of monkeypox. "It is necessary and very important to strengthen the surveillance and prevention of monkeypox epidemic at the social level," Wu Zunyou, chief epidemiologist at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention, said.

228.title: 3 police constables suspended in Pune history-sheeter attack case
228.article_body: The Pune police on Monday suspended three police constables for dereliction of duty in the case of history-sheeter Tushar Hambir's attack at Sassoon General Hospital earlier this month. The three constables were allegedly deployed for the security detail but were not present when the attack took place. The constables were suspended following a preliminary investigation into the same.

229.title: Korean actor Tae-oh enlists in military, to complete service in 2024
229.article_body: Korean actor Kang Tae-oh enlisted in the military on September 20. On Monday, the actor took to Instagram to thank his fans for their love and support. He said he will return after completing his military service, which is expected to end in 2024. Reportedly, Tae-ho will reprise his role of Lee Jun-ho in the sequel of 'Extraordinary Attorney Woo'.

230.title: Ex-Twitter CEO Dorsey to be questioned in Twitter-Musk lawsuit today
230.article_body: Former Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey will be questioned under oath today in Twitter's lawsuit against Elon Musk, court filings showed. Dorsey will be questioned by attorneys from both sides via Zoom. He had been subpoenaed last month by Musk seeking documents and communications about Twitter's use of mDAU, a measure of active users on its platform.

231.title: Will restore old pension scheme if elected to power in Gujarat: Rahul Gandhi
231.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Tuesday assured that if Congress is elected to power in Gujarat, then it will restore the old pension scheme, like in Rajasthan and Chhattisgarh. "By abolishing the old pension...BJP has made the elderly dependent from self-reliant," he tweeted. Earlier, thousands of retired government employees in Gujarat held protests demanding re-introduction of the old scheme.

232.title: B'luru doctor murdered for uploading nudes of live-in partner on social media
232.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a 27-year-old architect and two of her friends on charges of murdering her live-in partner for allegedly uploading her private photos on social media. Both Vikas and Prathibha were in a relationship and lived together. Prathibha recently discovered that Vikas uploaded her and her mother's photographs on social media using a fake ID, police said.

233.title: I was broke for most of my dating life, a girl gave me ₹5,000 monthly: Vijay
233.article_body: Actor Vijay Varma has revealed that most of his dating life happened when he was "broke", adding that it is "very tragic". The actor further said that paying bills on dates would become awkward and there were girls who were violently against him paying. "This girl...used to give me ₹5,000 or something like that monthly," the actor added.

234.title: Metro network in India now reached 775 km from less than 250 km in 2014: PM
234.article_body: Till 2014, metro network in the country was less than 250 kilometres long but today it is more than 775 kilometres, PM Narendra Modi said on Tuesday. PM Modi was addressing the Council of Mayors and Deputy Mayors of BJP in Gandhinagar, Gujarat via video conferencing. Furthermore, he said, "Tier-2 and tier-3 cities are now becoming centre of economic activities."

235.title: 35-yr-old driver found dead in Gurugram, neighbour booked for murder
235.article_body: A 35-year-old man, who worked as a driver at a private company, was found dead in bushes in a parking lot in Gurugram's Sector 33, police said. The man's neighbour was booked for the murder after his family alleged that he was killed over personal enmity. "Our neighbour [suspected] that his wife eloped with my son," the victim's father said.

236.title: 2 killed as powerful earthquake hits Mexico for 3rd time on same date
236.article_body: A magnitude 7.6 earthquake struck western Mexico on Monday, as the country was marking the anniversaries of two major quakes that had struck Mexico on the same date in 1985 and 2017. At least two people have been killed so far. One person was crushed by the facade of a department store while another was found dead at a mall.

237.title: Told Ayan 'One can play drinking game': Alia on 'Shiva' dialogue in Brahmastra
237.article_body: Discussing her constant repetition of the dialogue 'Shiva' in 'Brahmastra', actress Alia Bhatt said, "I told [director] Ayan Mukerji [that] people can...play a drinking game based on the number of times I've said Shiva." Talking about the same subject, Ranbir Kapoor said, "Ayan was...particular that when someone's in love, they've to enjoy saying the name of the person they love."

238.title: 'Monica, O My Darling' is homage to neo-noir crime comedies: Sikandar Kher
238.article_body: Actor Sikandar Kher said his upcoming film 'Monica, O My Darling' is "a homage" to neo-noir crime comedies, which he said isn't a much-explored genre in Bollywood. Talking about the Vasan Bala directorial, Kher said the characters in the film are "so nuanced that one cannot do justice to his part without getting an in-depth understanding of the other [roles]".

239.title: Don't need to criticise Kejriwal every morning & evening: Gambhir
239.article_body: East Delhi BJP MP Gautam Gambhir on being questioned over BJP's messaging in the national capital, said, "Social media politics won't take us anywhere. How much work we do on...ground is how we create...narrative." He added that he doesn't believe there's a need to criticise Delhi CM Kejriwal "every morning and evening". "It's about saving Delhi," he further said.

240.title: Rahul, Priyanka don't give importance to senior party leaders: Cong leader
240.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Pratibha Singh said that party leaders Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi Vadra don't give importance and time to senior Congress leaders, which is why dissatisfaction is growing within the party. The Print quoted Singh as saying, "Rahul Gandhi needs to learn political manoeuvres and how to address the generation gap in the Congress."

241.title: 16-yr-old girl raped by 6 in MP's Rewa, house of 1 suspect demolished
241.article_body: A 16-year-old girl was gangraped by six persons, including two minor boys, in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa district on Saturday, said police. All suspects have been arrested and the house of one of them was demolished, added police. The victim was visiting a temple with her fiancé when the perpetrators took her to a forest and raped her, said police.

242.title: TCS aims to increase Asia-Pacific region headcount by 15%: Report
242.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) is planning to grow its headcount by 15% across the Asia-Pacific region within the next year, Bloomberg reported. Girish Ramachandran, TCS' Asia-Pacific President said the company sees wage pressure easing as markets are opening up post the COVID-19 pandemic. The firm hired 1,00,000 consultants last year and will continue to do so, he added.

243.title: Bombay HC orders demolition of illegal construction at minister Narayan Rane's bungalow
243.article_body: The Bombay High Court on Tuesday ordered demolition of an unauthorised construction at bungalow of Union Minister of Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises, Narayan Rane, in Mumbai's Juhu. The court has ordered for the structure to be demolished in two weeks and has also imposed a ₹10 lakh fine. BMC had sent notice to Rane's Juhu residence over alleged alterations.

244.title: Will release a fix: Apple after users complain of camera shaking on iPhone 14 Pro
244.article_body: After some users complained of camera shaking and rattling sounds on using third-party apps like Instagram, Snapchat or TikTok on their iPhone 14 Pro and Pro Max, Apple has responded. Replying to a publication, Apple said it's "aware of the issue and a fix will be released next week." Some users had shared visuals of the issues on social media.

245.title: After 'Tandav' controversy, we were really sensitive with 'Jogi': Zafar
245.article_body: Director Ali Abbas Zafar, whose last directorial 'Tandav' landed in controversy for hurting religious sentiments, said he was "really sensitive" during the making of 'Jogi'. He said that 'Tandav' had offended people, which he didn't want to happen with his Diljit Dosanjh starrer. "I want to make content which unites the country rather than creating division," Zafar added.

246.title: Apple to raise App Store prices in several countries from October
246.article_body: Apple announced it will soon raise App Store prices, including in-app purchases in several countries such as Japan, Malaysia, Pakistan, Vietnam and every country that uses the euro as its currency. The new prices, which will exclude auto-renewable subscriptions, will be effective from October 5. The price hike in Vietnam is due to new local tax regulations, it said.

247.title: Cities can't be developed with election-centric approach: PM to BJP mayors
247.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, after virtually inaugurating the National Mayors' Conference in Gujarat's Gandhinagar on Tuesday, urged all BJP mayors to plan development of cities in a holistic manner. He said the elected representatives should not think of development just in terms of winning elections. "You cannot develop your city with an election-centric approach," PM Modi added.

248.title: Noida women safety unit patrols crowded city places, warning cards issued
248.article_body: The women's safety unit of Noida police on Monday launched an initiative that includes the deployment of officers in crowded places, along with personnel from the bike-borne Swayamsiddha team and anti-Romeo squads. Reports said that the unit checked over 100 spots and that 66 warning cards were issued to people near school and college premises.

249.title: Singer Enrique Iglesias kisses fan during Las Vegas event, shares video
249.article_body: Singer-songwriter Enrique Iglesias kissed a fan at an event in Las Vegas. He also shared a video of them kissing on Instagram. In the video, the female fan can be seen taking pictures with the singer, while he kissed her. Iglesias can then be seen moving her aside after a few seconds and walking away from her.

250.title: Only BJP leaders can go among public and say we've worked for you: Nadda
250.article_body: There are a few people who have always done politics in the name of farmers, BJP chief JP Nadda said on Tuesday in Gujarat's Gandhinagar. "BJP has worked to alleviate pain of farmers by understanding them," he added. "I can confidently say that it's just BJP leaders who can go among public and say we've worked for you," he stated.

251.title: 1st multiplex to open in Kashmir today after 30 years
251.article_body: For the first time in about 30 years, a multiplex will be opened in Kashmir today. There will be a special screening of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. According to an official, the Srinagar-based multiplex has three large auditoriums with a seating capacity of over 500 people at a time. Designed by INOX, the auditoriums possess Dolby Atmos digital sound systems.

252.title: 1 arrested in Jharkhand for running over pregnant woman with tractor
252.article_body: A 26-year-old man, identified as Roshan Singh, was arrested in Jharkhand's Hazaribagh following the death of a 27-year-old pregnant woman after a loan recovery agent allegedly ran a tractor over her, police said. A search is on for the other accused in this incident, police added. Roshan is a "third party vendor engaged by a finance company", police stated.

253.title: Jodhpur man beats elderly father with a stick in street, arrested; video surfaces
253.article_body: A video has surfaced that shows a man beating up his elderly father with a stick, slapping and punching him in a street in Rajasthan's Jodhpur. The accused was arrested under Section 151 of the CrPC (Code Of Criminal Procedure). Police said that this was not the first time that the man had attacked his father.

254.title: Washing Machine makes the front page: Derek O'Brien on probe agencies
254.article_body: Sharing a news report which said that the percentage of political leaders who came under CBI scanner surged during NDA's rule, TMC's Derek O'Brien compared probe agencies with 'washing machines'. Sharing the front page of a newspaper, he wrote, "Washing Machine makes the front page." "Atrocities for others, favours for your own," SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said sharing the report.

255.title: Nobody needs anybody's nod to contest Congress president polls: Jairam
255.article_body: Following reports that Congress MP Shashi Tharoor received party interim chief Sonia Gandhi's nod to contest the polls for the party's new president, party leader Jairam Ramesh told Hindustan Times, "Nobody needs anybody's nod to contest." He added that anybody who wants to contest can do so and this has been the "consistent position of...Congress president and Rahul Gandhi".

256.title: Natco Pharma stock gains after court's nod for insecticide launch
256.article_body: After Natco Pharma received the Delhi High Court's approval for the launch of chlorantraniliprole, an insecticide and its formulations, through a non-infringing process, its shares gained over 3% intraday on Tuesday. At 11:57 am, its shares were trading 1.39% up at ₹793.65 apiece on the NSE. Its shares touched a 52-week high of ₹942.15 on January 17 this year.

257.title: Sanjay Kapoor auditioned for Salman's role in 'Maine Pyar Kiya': Bhagyashree
257.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree said that before Salman Khan was finalised for 'Maine Pyar Kiya', actors such as Sanjay Kapoor, Kunal Goswami and Prosenjit Chatterjee had auditioned to play the male lead in the film. Bhagyashree added that director Sooraj Barjatya "was very keen" on casting her as the female lead and she was his "first and last choice".

258.title: Lufthansa responds after user asks 'was Punjab CM Mann deplaned for being drunk'
258.article_body: Lufthansa has responded after a user shared a screenshot of a news claiming Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann was deplaned in Frankfurt as he was drunk. "Can you confirm if the Indian was over drunk," the user tweeted. "We do not provide any information regarding individual passengers. Flight departed later than originally planned due to a delayed inbound flight," Lufthansa said.

259.title: Brazil's former President Lula leads over Bolsonaro ahead of election: Poll
259.article_body: Brazilian Presidential candidate Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva holds a lead over President Jair Bolsonaro less than two weeks before the election, an IPEC poll showed. According to the survey, Lula had 47% of voters' support against 31% for Bolsonaro, compared to 46% and 31% respectively, estimated last week. Bolsonaro's disapproval rating has increased to 47% from 45% last week.

260.title: Mumbai man arrested for repeatedly raping minor step-daughter for 2 yrs
260.article_body: Police have arrested a 50-year-old man from Mumbai for allegedly raping his minor step-daughter repeatedly for the past two years. According to police, the girl's biological mother had earlier noticed the abuse and had warned her husband not to repeat it. However, she decided to file an FIR after she caught him sexually assaulting her eldest daughter again.

261.title: Bhagavad Gita to be introduced in K'taka schools soon: BC Nagesh
261.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh on Monday announced that the state government is contemplating the introduction of Bhagavad Gita in schools and colleges from this academic year. He added that the text will be taught as part of the moral education syllabus. "The discussion is ongoing. A committee will be formed and we'll take a decision soon," he further said.

262.title: Crompton Greaves approves 6% stake sale in Butterfly Gandhimathi
262.article_body: Crompton Greaves Consumer Electricals approved the sale of around 10.72 lakh equity shares at face value of ₹10 apiece of its material subsidiary Butterfly Gandhimathi Appliances. This sale represents up to 6% of its total issued and paid-up equity share capital and will be via an offer for sale. Butterfly Gandhimathi's shares closed at ₹1,506.20 apiece on BSE on Monday.

263.title: All is not well with our world: Priyanka Chopra at UN General Assembly
263.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra addressed the United Nations General Assembly on Monday, saying, "As we all know, all is not well with our world." She spoke about the effects of COVID-19, climate crisis and the UN Sustainable Development Goals. Priyanka also shared videos and photos from the event including a picture with Malala Yousafzai, Amanda Gorman, Somaya Faruqi and Judith Hill.

264.title: J&K Congress passes resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as party President
264.article_body: Ahead of the Congress Presidential election, the Jammu and Kashmir unit of the party passed a resolution to appoint Rahul Gandhi as Congress chief again. Various state units including Rajasthan, Chhattisgarh, Bihar and Tamil Nadu have already passed the resolution backing the Wayanad MP. The election for the Congress President is set to be held on October 17.

265.title: Majority verdict by larger bench will prevail: Supreme Court
265.article_body: The Supreme Court has ruled that a majority verdict by a larger bench will prevail over a unanimous decision by a bench of lesser strength. Although the number of judges constituting the majority on the larger bench may be less than or equal to the number of judges on the smaller bench.

266.title: 5 killed in Iran during protests over woman's death in custody: Rights group
266.article_body: At least five people were killed in Iran on Monday after security forces opened fire during protests over the death of a 22-year-old woman in police custody, a Kurdish rights group said. Mahsa Amini fell into a coma last week, hours after morality police held her for allegedly breaking hijab rules. Reportedly, a number of protesters had been arrested .

267.title: You've to be glam with Karan, or he won't call you on 'Koffee With Karan': Gauri
267.article_body: Shah Rukh Khan's wife Gauri Khan, who will feature in the upcoming episode of 'Koffee With Karan', stated that she was looking forward to getting ready. "You have to be glam when you are with Karan (Johar), otherwise he won't take you on his show," she added. Gauri further said Karan has never asked her to appear on the show.

268.title: Alleged gas leak causes fire during cremation in Punjab; 22 hurt
268.article_body: At least 22 people suffered burn injuries after an alleged gas leak during a man's cremation at an electric crematorium caused a fire to spread in Punjab's Moga on Monday. A former village sarpanch said that the man's family and some villagers were standing near the crematorium. Of those injured, three people were admitted to civil hospital, a doctor said.

269.title: Should've apologised immediately: Faisal on Aamir's intolerance remark
269.article_body: Talking about Aamir Khan's statement on intolerance in 2015, his brother Faisal Khan said, "He should have apologised immediately after that thing came out, not when...'Laal Singh Chaddha' was releasing." "That seems opportunistic," added Faisal. "There is no harm in...correcting yourself," he stated. Discussing 'Laal Singh Chaddha', Faisal said, "Aamir should have selected a better script."

270.title: Custodial torture: Owaisi after beards of Muslim inmates shaved in MP
270.article_body: Five Muslim prisoners in Madhya Pradesh's Rajgarh jail have alleged that the jail authorities forcibly shaved their beards off. According to a prisoner, the jailer asked him, "Are you from Pakistan?" before shaving his beard. AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi called the incident "custodial torture and a violation of Article 25". The jailer, NS Rana, has denied the allegations.

271.title: 3 arrested for smuggling drugs via social media in Greater Noida
271.article_body: The Gautam Buddha Nagar Police arrested three people for allegedly smuggling drugs and supplying them to college students across the country, including in Noida and Greater Noida. The accused reportedly did business through social media and traded in cryptocurrency to evade identification. They were arrested after the DCP posed as a buyer and lured them into coming to Greater Noida.

272.title: Child abduction messages on social media fake: Mumbai Police
272.article_body: The Mumbai Police said that news circulating on social media of children getting kidnapped from places like Vikhroli and Ghatkopar are all fake and asked people not to believe in such rumours. Senior officials visited the sites mentioned in the fake messages, conducted a probe in the areas and found all these news to be fake, DCP Prashant Kadam said.

273.title: BJP is well-oiled machinery in Gujarat: AAP's Raghav Chadha
273.article_body: AAP leader Raghav Chadha, who has been appointed co-incharge of the party's Gujarat unit, said that BJP in Gujarat is a well-oiled machinery with unlimited muscle, media and money power. "All media outlets have been given directions to blackout AAP...We understand that with BJP, no election is a level playing field, but this is at a different level," he added.

274.title: FIR against Pune man for posing as Maha CM in photo with gangster Mohol
274.article_body: A man from Pune's Ambegaon was booked for allegedly posing as Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde in a photograph with gangster Sharad Mohol, police said. This comes after a sub-inspector of the crime branch filed a complaint against the accused at the Bundgarden Police Station, police added. The photograph with Mohol maligned Shinde's image, police further said.

275.title: ICC releases list of new rules to be introduced in international cricket from October 1
275.article_body: The ICC released list of new rules that will be introduced in international cricket from October 1. Among the new rules, an incoming batter will be required to be ready to take strike within two minutes in Tests and ODIs. New batters will face next delivery after player is out caught even if batters have crossed before catch is taken.

276.title: First images of Mars captured by the world's most powerful telescope released
276.article_body: The NASA has shared first images of Mars captured by James Webb Space Telescope, the world's most powerful space telescope. A close-up photo of Mars reveals surface features such as Huygens Crater, dark volcanic Syrtis Major, and Hellas Basin. A 'heat map' showing the light being given off by Mars as it loses heat was also captured by the telescope.

277.title: Zomato delivery agent molests woman on pretext of asking for water in Pune
277.article_body: A Zomato food delivery agent was arrested for allegedly molesting a woman in Pune. The 19-year-old woman alleged that the 40-year-old delivery executive asked for water upon delivering her food. When she gave him water, he pulled her close and allegedly kissed her on her cheeks, she told the police.

278.title: Does Virat Kohli's ton as opener create more of a problem?: Ponting
278.article_body: Discussing Virat Kohli's 71st international hundred, which he scored recently as an opener, Ricky Ponting said, "Does that create more of a problem than we thought?" "What are we going to do...going into...T20 World Cup 2022?" added Ponting. Reacting to people stating that Kohli should open in T20 World Cup 2022, Gautam Gambhir recently said, "Don't start this nonsense."

279.title: Shashi Tharoor, Ashok Gehlot likely contenders for Cong chief: Report
279.article_body: Congress leaders Shashi Tharoor and Ashok Gehlot have emerged as the likely contenders for the post of the party's president, as per media reports. Tharoor has reportedly got the nod to contest from interim Congress chief Sonia Gandhi. Gehlot is a supporter of the Gandhi family and has reportedly been trying to persuade Rahul Gandhi to run for the post.

280.title: Scientists create world's first cloned wild Arctic wolf; pics go viral
280.article_body: A wild Arctic wolf was successfully cloned for the first time in the world by scientists at a Beijing-based gene firm. "After two years of painstaking efforts, the Arctic wolf was cloned successfully," Global Times quoted Beijing-based Sinogene Biotechnology Co's general manager Mi Jidong as saying. The wolf named Maya is in good health, according to the company.

281.title: Fortuner car hits multiple vehicles, drags man for 100 metres in Delhi; video surfaces
281.article_body: A Toyota Fortuner car crashed into several parked vehicles and hit a 19-year-old man on a two-wheeler, dragging him for around 100 metres in Delhi's Karol Bagh on Monday evening. The incident was caught on a CCTV camera. Police said the Fortuner's driver was caught and they have sent him for a medical examination to ascertain if he was drunk.

282.title: They wouldn't have sat me back there: Trump on Biden's pic at Queen's funeral
282.article_body: Commenting on a pic showing US President Joe Biden placed 14 rows behind King Charles III at Queen's funeral, Donald Trump wrote, "If I were president, they wouldn't have sat me back there – and our country would be much different than it's right now!" "This is what's happened to America in just two short years. No respect!" he added.

283.title: Sonia gives nod to Tharoor to contest Congress President polls: Reports
283.article_body: According to reports, Congress interim chief Sonia Gandhi has given the nod to MP Shashi Tharoor to contest for the party's President post. "Shashi Tharoor reached out to Sonia Gandhi in a meeting...and said that he can make internal democracy stronger. Sonia replied that he (Shashi Tharoor) can contest if he wants. Anybody can contest elections," said the sources.

284.title: Himachal Congress passes resolution authorising Sonia to choose party chief
284.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress passed a resolution authorising interim President Sonia Gandhi to choose the next National President of the party. The resolution also enables Sonia to nominate the new state Congress chief and AICC members. "We passed the resolution in the presence of all the delegates...and everyone extended their support for this," state Congress chief Pratibha Singh said.

285.title: Non-BJP front not possible without Congress' inclusion: Sharad Pawar
285.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Monday said a non-BJP front will only be possible with the inclusion of the Congress party. Pawar further stated that he has met Opposition leaders, including Bihar CM Nitish Kumar and West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, who expressed their views on forming a non-BJP front. But, no planning has been done yet, he added.

286.title: AAP begins 'selfie with kooda' campaign on landfills issue before MCD polls
286.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party has started 'selfie with kooda' campaign to highlight the issue of waste and landfills. The party has also started another campaign named 'BJP ka chamatkaar dekho, koode ka pahad dekho'. Senior AAP leader Dilip Pandey said, "Our slogan is kooda, kachra aur corruption, inme BJP hai number one."

287.title: 1.8 tons of cocaine worth $278 million seized in Nigeria
287.article_body: Authorities in Nigeria have seized 1.8 tons of cocaine which has an estimated street value of $278 million. According to the National Drug Law Enforcement Agency, the cocaine, recovered from a warehouse in Lagos, was to be sold to customers in Europe and Asia. At least four people believed to be members of an international drug syndicate have been arrested.

288.title: Man hiding 1 kg gold in stomach caught at Kerala's Karipur airport
288.article_body: A 36-year-old man was arrested after allegedly getting caught carrying 1.063 kg gold in his stomach at the Karipur airport in Kerala on Monday. He tried to hide the gold inside four capsules. After the police could not find the gold on his body, an X-ray was conducted, which revealed the four capsules containing gold inside his stomach.

289.title: Boundary wall collapses in Noida's Jalvayu Vihar society, 4 dead
289.article_body: At least four persons were killed as a boundary wall in Jalvayu Vihar society in Noida's Sector 21 collapsed on Tuesday morning. "Noida Authority had given a contract for drainage repair work...We've been told when labourers were pulling out bricks, the wall collapsed," Noida DM Suhas LY said. "Police and Fire Department teams are present at the spot," he added.

290.title: Experience 'Mobile Dhamaka' this Amazon Great Indian Festival: Amazon
290.article_body: With the Amazon Great Indian Festival around the corner, Amazon has hinted towards a 'Mobile Dhamaka', with 5G smartphones starting at just ₹11,999. Amazon is also offering Amazon Pay rewards worth ₹1,500 and a free screen replacement, with total additional benefits up to ₹2,300, it said. The festival will be live from September 23.

291.title: Two policemen booked in Maha over impersonation in LLB written exam
291.article_body: A sub-divisional police officer and a constable have been booked in Maharashtra's Jalna over alleged impersonation in a written exam for LLB. The constable appeared in place of the SDPO for the exam held at Bhakt College in February 2020 while the latter was reportedly on official duty. A probe began after an activist submitted a complaint against the two.

292.title: Russia claims Ottawa embassy was attacked; summons Canadian envoy
292.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry on Monday summoned the Canadian ambassador and issued a protest over attacks on the Russian embassy in Ottawa. The ministry claimed that an unknown person threw a Molotov cocktail onto the grounds of the Russian embassy in Ottawa on September 12. It also said "aggressive" protestors had blocked an entrance to the consular section of the embassy.

293.title: 'Laal Singh...' was not a wow film: Aamir's brother Faisal Khan
293.article_body: Aamir Khan's brother Faisal Khan said 'Laal Singh Chaddha' was not a "wow film". He said he liked the film "in parts, but not completely". "With Aamir and other good actors, you expect them to do too good work. They should blow your mind. But that didn't happen with 'Laal Singh Chaddha', unfortunately," he added.

294.title: We will not allow ideology of BJP, RSS to divide our country: Rahul Gandhi
294.article_body: Rahul Gandhi said that the BJP spreads hatred and violence, adding that we will not allow the ideology of RSS to divide our country. He was addressing Congress workers on Monday as part of the party's Bharat Jodo Yatra in Kerala's Cherthala. "Do you think a divided society can build hospitals, roads and can educate our children?" he added.

295.title: SpaceX test-fires record 7 engines on Super Heavy Booster 7; video surfaces
295.article_body: SpaceX test-fired seven engines on Starship Super Heavy prototype 'Booster 7', marking the highest number of its new Raptor engines ever tested at the same time. Commenting on a video of the test, CEO Elon Musk said the chamber pressures on all the seven engines "looked good". He added SpaceX will fire all 33 engines in a few weeks.

296.title: 3 men thrashed for objecting to public drinking in Gurugram
296.article_body: Three men were allegedly assaulted in Gurugram's Sector 38 after they objected to two men drinking on their car's bonnet, the police said. The police further informed that they received a call from one of the injured persons who said that a group of around 15 men was assaulting him and his friends outside a liquor shop.

297.title: Richa Chadha to wear her family’s heirloom pieces for wedding: Report
297.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha is reportedly wearing her family's heirloom pieces for her wedding, which is said to be taking place on October 6. The actress is also getting some hand-me-down pieces from her grandmother to be reworked for her D-Day. As per a report, Richa's wedding jewellery is inspired by the royal aesthetics of Rajasthan.

298.title: Putting lots of lights, extra sparkle; looking forward to it: Gauri on Diwali
298.article_body: While talking about Diwali 2022, Gauri Khan said that she is looking forward to it this year. "Well, we haven't started yet but yes, decorating the house and putting loads of lights and an extra sparkle," she said, adding, "I think, in festivals, you look forward to just the family being together and celebrating something and looking forward to something."

299.title: Need to feel proud of our history, we can't be China, Russia or USA: RSS chief
299.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said India needs to retain its essence and identity by embracing its scriptures and ancient history. "There's a need to read and feel proud of our scriptures and history...create a narrative based on them. We cannot be China, Russia or USA. We cannot call it progress, rather we would become a laughing stock," Bhagwat added.

300.title: Odisha's Nandankanan zoo planning to bring 2 cheetahs from Dubai
300.article_body: The authorities at the Nandankanan Zoological Park in Odisha's Bhubaneswar are planning to bring two cheetahs from Dubai. They will be brought as part of an animal exchange programme between the zoo and the Dubai Safari Park. The authorities are also planning to bring five African white lions and chimpanzees in exchange for Manipur brow-antlered deer, hippopotamuses and blackbucks.

301.title: Malaika-Amrita's show 'Arora Sisters' to feature Arbaaz & Arjun: Report
301.article_body: Malaika Arora and Amrita Arora's upcoming show 'Arora Sisters' will reportedly feature Arjun Kapoor and Arbaaz Khan. As per a report, Arjun and Arbaaz will feature in different episodes of the show, which is said to be a peek into the personal and professional lives of Arora siblings. While Malaika is currently dating Arjun Kapoor, she divorced Arbaaz in 2017.

302.title: New back pain test helped 10,000+ people avoid spine surgery: QI Spine
302.article_body: QI Spine shared that a team of spine specialists has found a breakthrough in the treatment of back pain without surgery called Digital Spine Analysis (DSA) to accurately identify the weak areas in the back & neck. QI Spine combines the experience of 300+ doctors, backed by data intelligence aiming to offer the most accurate diagnosis.

303.title: What are you, Karan: Kangana on reports of Brahmastra beating 'The Kashmir...'
303.article_body: While sharing filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri's tweet about 'Brahmastra' beating 'The Kashmir Files' at the box office, actress Kangana Ranaut asked, "What are you Karan Johar ji". "The audacity to belittle The Kashmir Files, a film made on Hindu genocide (and) also trying to ride on its success," she wrote on her Instagram Stories.

304.title: News of me being injured in stone pelting incident in Kashmir is inaccurate: Emraan
304.article_body: Following reports of stone pelting at a film crew in Kashmir, Emraan Hashmi said, "The news of me being injured in a stone pelting incident is inaccurate." Emraan is currently shooting for Marathi filmmaker Tejas Vijay Deoskar's Ground Zero in Kashmir. However, Emraan neither confirmed nor denied whether the incident happened with his film crew.

305.title: Spider spotted on Queen Elizabeth's coffin during her funeral, video goes viral
305.article_body: A video of a spider crawling on top of Queen Elizabeth II's coffin during her funeral service on Monday went viral online. The spider was spotted on the handwritten note, penned by King Charles III for the Queen, placed upon the coffin. "Most famous spider in world right now," a user said, while another wrote, "God save the Royal Spider."

306.title: Queen's horse Emma bids farewell to late monarch at Windsor Castle, pic surfaces
306.article_body: Queen Elizabeth II's horse, Carltonlima Emma, bid farewell to the late monarch as her coffin processed through Windsor Castle on Monday. The horse was accompanied by Terry Pendry, the Queen’s head groom, who has held the position for the past 25 years. The Stud Groom bowed his head as the State Hearse passed by, while Emma stood by his side.

307.title: Police team attacked, constable's uniform torn in Gurugram; 1 arrested
307.article_body: A man from Gurugram's Palra village was arrested for attacking police and tearing a constable's uniform for asking him to stop creating ruckus. The incident occurred on Sunday when police went to the accused's house responding to a call of a domestic row. According to Head Constable Amir Singh, the accused also threatened to kill the officers before being arrested.

308.title: K'taka hijab ban part of pattern to marginalise minorities: Petitioner to SC
308.article_body: Petitioners who challenged the hijab ban in Karnataka educational institutes told the Supreme Court that the ban shows "a pattern to marginalise the minority community". The petitioner further stated that hijab is part of their identity, asking if wearing it threatens the unity or integrity of the country. "That nobody is saying...Even the [High Court] judgment doesn't say," SC stated.

309.title: Adani Group to double cement making capacity to 140 mn tonnes in 5 yrs
309.article_body: Adani Group is planning to double its cement manufacturing capacity to 140 million tonnes in next five years. Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani said he saw a multifold rise in cement demand in India. Last week, Adani Group completed its $6.5 billion acquisition of Ambuja Cements and ACC. Adani Group has cement production capacity of 70 million tonnes per annum.

310.title: Central investigation agencies can open offices at my home: Bihar Dy CM
310.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said that central investigation agencies including CBI, Enforcement Directorate and Income Tax are free to open their offices at his home. This comes two days after the CBI moved a Delhi court seeking the cancellation of bail granted to Tejashwi in the IRCTC scam. "BJP is scared of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections," he added.

311.title: US engineer freed by Taliban in exchange for Afghan drug trafficker
311.article_body: The Taliban on Monday released a US engineer in exchange for an Afghan tribal leader detained by the US in 2005 over drug charges. The US Navy veteran Mark Frerichs, who was taken hostage in 2020, was exchanged at Kabul airport for Bashir Noorzai. US President Joe Biden said that the swap required "difficult decisions" that he didn't take lightly.

312.title: 56-year-old man moves Delhi HC to ensure family doesn't perform last rites
312.article_body: A 56-year-old man with cardiac ailments approached Delhi High Court to prevent his wife, daughter or son-in-law from performing his last rites. He claimed his family treated him with cruelty and he wasn't even invited to his daughter's wedding. He wants his body to be handed over to a man who took care of him and is "like his son".

313.title: 47-year-old man falls before moving metro train in Noida, dies
313.article_body: A 47-year-old man died after he fell before a moving metro train at Noida's Golf Course Metro Station on Monday. The bystanders said that the man had jumped in front of the train, an ACP stated. However, a senior police officer said that the man's wife claimed that he had gone to check the train when he slipped and fell.

314.title: Car falls into canal in Pune; driver & passenger manage to come out
314.article_body: A car fell into a canal at night in Pune's Hadapsar after the driver lost control of the vehicle, according to fire brigade officials. However, the driver and a passenger who was in the car managed to come out as the canal didn't have much water. The car was pulled out of the canal using a crane service.

315.title: Unseen photo of Queen Elizabeth II hiking released after her burial
315.article_body: The Royal Family has released a previously unseen photo of the Queen after her private burial took place. The photo of the Queen was taken at Balmoral in 1971 and shows her hiking in the moorlands surrounding the castle in Scotland. The image was shared on social media with the caption, "May flights of Angels sing thee to thy rest."

316.title: EC proposes lowering anonymous donation limit, cap cash donations: Reports
316.article_body: The Election Commission (EC) has proposed bringing down anonymous donations to political parties from ₹20,000 to ₹2,000, as per reports. The EC has further proposed to cap cash donations at 20% or a maximum of ₹20 crore, reports added. The poll body has reportedly also recommended that each candidate open a separate bank account for election purposes.

317.title: Karnataka man tells wife he will marry another, gives triple talaq
317.article_body: A 32-year-old man was arrested for allegedly giving triple talaq to his 29-year-old wife on the premises of a court, where they came for a domestic abuse case hearing. He told his wife that he was marrying another woman and was giving talaq to her as per Sharia. The woman had accused her husband of assault over dowry.

318.title: BJP got booking of 13 venues for Kejriwal's event in Gujarat cancelled: AAP
318.article_body: The AAP in Gujarat alleged that BJP has got bookings of 13 venues in Vadodara cancelled by threatening the owners to ensure that its national convener Arvind Kejriwal's programme cannot be held there. AAP leader Isudan Gadhvi further alleged that "corrupt BJP" has been preventing our spokespersons from debate by threatening TV media. BJP is now rattled, Gadhvi added.

319.title: Monsoon caused damage of ₹3,600 cr in K'taka this year: CM Bommai
319.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai informed that monsoon this year caused a damage to the tune of ₹3,600 crore to the crops, houses and infrastructure in the state. He further informed that the state would claim ₹1,645 crore from the Centre under the National Disaster Relief Fund. "More than 10.06-lakh hectare of agricultural land and 42,048 houses were damaged," he added.

320.title: Uber blames teenage hacking group Lapsus$ for recent security breach
320.article_body: Uber said that a hacker associated with the Lapsus$ hacking group was to blame for a breach of its internal systems last week and reiterated that no customer data was compromised during the attack. Said to be composed largely of teenagers, Lapsus$ has targeted companies like Samsung, Microsoft, Vodafone and Nvidia in the past.

321.title: I'm not Ranveer Singh, I still don't get to choose a film: Aparshakti
321.article_body: Actor Aparshakti Khurana said in an interview that he still doesn't have opportunities to pick or choose a film, adding, "I am no Ranveer Singh yet." He further said the audience decides how an actor will be. "They decided Tiger Shroff is an action hero, Ranbir Kapoor is a romantic hero and Ayushmann Khurrana will do content-driven films," Aparshakti added.

322.title: TRS govt on ventilator, will collapse soon: Telangana BJP chief
322.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar on Monday criticised CM K Chandrashekar Rao-led state government over the dumping yard issue in Medchal-Malkajgiri district's Jawahar Nagar. "TRS government is on...ventilator and the government will collapse," he said. "The dumping yard issue is affecting...public's health. Give the power to BJP. We'll see how the...problem is solved," Kumar added.

323.title: 2 house burglaries reported in Pune, gold worth ₹18.80 lakh stolen
323.article_body: Two separate cases of house break-in were reported at different residential societies in Pune. In one incident, the suspects entered a house while the resident was away and made off with  ₹5.40 lakh cash and gold ornaments worth ₹1.6 lakh. In the other case, ₹4.28 lakh cash and gold ornaments worth ₹17.20 lakh were stolen.

324.title: Burglars steal phones worth ₹6 lakh while 5 guards slept in Punjab
324.article_body: Six unidentified burglars stole 26 phones worth ₹6 lakh from a showroom in Punjab's Ludhiana on Monday. The showroom didn't have a shutter and all the five security guards who were deputed there were found asleep when the incident occurred. The incident was caught on CCTV cameras and shows the burglars entering shop at 5 am while the guards slept.

325.title: India reports 4,043 new COVID-19 cases, daily positivity rate now at 1.37%
325.article_body: India reported 4,043 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 4,858 COVID-19 cases. Meanwhile, 4,676 recoveries were recorded across India in the last 24 hours. The active cases in the country now stand at 47,379. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 1.37%.

326.title: Delhi's Chandni Chowk redevelopment project to begin soon
326.article_body: The Delhi government is planning to revive and beautify the historical architectural buildings in the Chandni Chowk area. Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia held a meeting with officials from various departments and discussed the plan for the second phase of the redevelopment project. The first phase of the redevelopment project was completed on September 12, 2021.

327.title: 11 killed due to lightning in 3 districts of Bihar; CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia
327.article_body: As many as 11 persons were killed due to lightning in three districts of Bihar, four each in Purnia and Araria and three in Supaul. CM Nitish Kumar announced a ₹4 lakh ex-gratia each for the deceased's families. "Be careful in bad weather. Follow the suggestions issued by the Disaster Management Department to (protect yourself) from thunderstorms," Bihar CM tweeted.

328.title: Should buy a lot of cars: BJP leader on Kamal Nath's 'lend my car' remark
328.article_body: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya reacted to MP Congress chief Kamal Nath's remark where he said his party wouldn't stop anyone from quitting and that he would lend his car if any member wants to go and join BJP. "Then he should buy a lot of cars. There are a lot of people not happy with his leadership," Vijayvargiya said.

329.title: Sensex gains 600 points, Nifty above 17,700 in opening trade
329.article_body: The benchmark indices opened on a positive note on Tuesday with the Sensex up 600 points at 59,761 points and Nifty gaining 164.20 points to 17,786.50 points. Hindalco Industries, IndusInd Bank, Tata Motors, Bajaj Finserv and Tech Mahindra were among the significant Nifty gainers. All sectoral indices opened in the green with Nifty IT and Nifty Media topping the charts.

330.title: World chess champ Carlsen resigns after just 1 move against Niemann, sparks controversy
330.article_body: World chess champion Magnus Carlsen resigned after just one move against US' 19-year-old Grandmaster Hans Niemann in Julius Baer Generation online tournament, sparking controversy. Earlier this month, Carlsen quit $500,000 Sinquefield Cup after losing to Niemann. He had confirmed withdrawal by posting video of a quote by football manager Jose Mourinho, reading, "If I speak, I'm in big trouble."

331.title: New Zealand announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
331.article_body: New Zealand have announced their 15-member squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup 2022. Pacer Trent Boult and all-rounder Jimmy Neesham, who recently declined a central contract, find a place in the squad. Further, opener Martin Guptill will feature in his seventh T20 World Cup. Kane Williamson will lead New Zealand for the third time in the T20 World Cup.

332.title: Audience gets I'm not saying all Britishers are villains: Rajamouli on RRR
332.article_body: While talking about ‘RRR’ working in the UK despite showing “British in poor light”, filmmaker SS Rajamouli said that the audience understands. “If a British is playing the villain, they understand that I am not saying all the Britishers are villains," he said, adding, "In this film, a particular guy is a villain and a particular guy is a hero."

333.title: Delhi Police busts fake passport and visa racket
333.article_body: The Delhi Police busted a fake visa racket that conned people on the pretext of sending them to foreign countries and arranging the required travel documents such as passports and visas. One of the three masterminds involved in the racket has been arrested. The police seized 19 forged passports, 26 forged visas and over 165 immigration stamps of different countries.

334.title: 5 plastic carry bag manufacturing units shut down, fined in Punjab
334.article_body: The Punjab Pollution Control Board (PPCB) has shut down five plastic bag manufacturing units and imposed a fine of ₹2 lakh on each of them following raids. The state power distribution company has also been asked to cut the power supply to these industrial units. "More inspections will be carried out in future," PPCB chief engineer in Ludhiana said.

335.title: I was caged at Aamir's house: Brother Faissal Khan
335.article_body: Talking about turning down an offer to appear in the upcoming season of the reality show Bigg Boss, Aamir Khan's brother Faissal said participating in the show would be akin to being caged. He further said that he has already been caged once before in Aamir's house, and would not want to sacrifice his freedom at any cost.

336.title: Reconstruction on Mumbai's 150-yr-old Carnac Bridge to start by Nov
336.article_body: The reconstruction of 150-year-old British-era Carnac Bridge in Mumbai will start in the next two months. The length of the new bridge will be 70 metres and the width 26.5 metres, while the estimated cost is around ₹53.08 crores, as per report. The BMC has set a deadline to complete the reconstruction of the bridge by June 2024.

337.title: I worked in banks for 9 years, it was a very bad mistake: Ashneer Grover
337.article_body: BharatPe’s ex-MD Ashneer Grover said it took him nine years to figure out that he wanted to become an entrepreneur. "I worked in banks for nine years...it was a very bad mistake," said Grover. He added that he aspired to get to a certain standard in life, but once he did, he started to feel his job was suffocating him.

338.title: 'Tiranga' is my attempt to keep doing disruptive content: Parineeti
338.article_body: Actress Parineeti Chopra said her upcoming film 'Code Name: Tiranga' will present her in a "whole new avatar". She said the film, which features her as a RAW agent, is an attempt to keep pushing her boundaries as a performer and do "disruptive content". "I can assure you that we intend to shock and awe with this film," she added.

339.title: BJP wants a handful of people to control entire country: Rahul Gandhi
339.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that BJP wants to build a country where a handful of people control the entire country. "Because of this, millions and millions of people are drowning in poverty, youngsters can't dream of being employed," Gandhi added while addressing a public program during the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Kerala's Alappuzha.

340.title: Mexico's foreign minister tweets selfie with wife at Queen's funeral; criticised
340.article_body: Mexico's foreign minister was criticised after he posted a selfie with his wife from Queen Elizabeth's funeral in London on Monday. Tweeting the photo, Marcelo Ebrard wrote, "At the State Funeral of HM Queen Elizabeth II." A Twitter user commented, “You're not at a birthday party to be taking selfies," while another wrote, "He is [a] typical tourist".

341.title: KPSC aspirants hold protest in Bengaluru over delay in results
341.article_body: Many government job aspirants gathered at Bengaluru's Freedom park on Monday to protest against the delay in results of exams conducted by Karnataka Public Service Commission (KPSC). They demanded a provisional schedule of each examination to be published along with the notification. They also sought a UPSC-like annual schedule of events to be published.

342.title: Russian military firm trying to recruit 1,500 felons for Ukraine war: US
342.article_body: The Russian private military company, the Wagner Group,  is trying to recruit over 1,500 convicted felons to take part in Russia's war in Ukraine, but many are refusing to join, a senior US defence official told reporters. "Our information indicates that Wagner has been suffering high losses in Ukraine, especially and unsurprisingly among young and inexperienced fighters," the official added.

343.title: NSE adds Delta Corp and Escorts Kubota to today's F&O ban list
343.article_body: The NSE has added Delta Corp and Escorts Kubota to its Futures and Options (F&O) ban list for Tuesday after the scrips crossed 95% of the market-wide position limit. On Monday, Delta Corp fell 4.6% while Escorts Kubota rose 8% to end at ₹2,086. Indiabulls Housing Finance, India Cements, PVR and RBL Bank are already on the F&O ban list.

344.title: Supreme Court stays dismissal of IPS officer who probed Ishrat Jahan encounter
344.article_body: Supreme Court granted a week's stay on the Centre's dismissal order of Satish Chandra Verma, an IPS officer who assisted CBI in its investigation into the Ishrat Jahan encounter case in Gujarat. "It's for the High Court to consider...whether the order of stay...be continued beyond a week," SC said. This comes after Delhi HC stayed the dismissal till September 19.

345.title: Pushing myself out of comfort zone with 'Guns & Gulaabs': Dulquer
345.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan said he has pushed himself out of his comfort zone for his upcoming series 'Guns & Gulaabs'. The Raj & DK directorial also stars Rajkummar Rao and Adarsh Gourav. "It is set in this imaginary town, and all these characters - what brings us together - I think it will be a fun ride," Dulquer added.

346.title: TMT to introduce over 100 electric buses in Thane
346.article_body: The Thane Municipal Transport Undertaking (TMT) is planning to introduce over 100 state-of-the-art electric buses in the city. An order for 123 e-buses has been given to Olectra Greentech Limited (OLECTRA) and Evey Trans Private Limited (EVEY) consortium, which will deliver them in nine months. Of the total buses, 71 will be air-conditioned (AC) while the rest will be non-AC.

347.title: 'Baahubali' is the only film I've seen of hers: Bhandarkar on Tamannaah
347.article_body: Director Madhur Bhandarkar said 'Baahubali' is the only film he has seen of his 'Babli Bouncer' actress Tamannaah Bhatia. "For me, when I met her, I just surrendered to the vision and followed my instincts. And she is definitely a director's actress," he said. The director added Tamannaah has performed "flawlessly" in 'Babli Bouncer' and called her "an amazing talent".

348.title: After Gulistan, BMC to demolish another illegal apartment in Mumbai
348.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will soon demolish an illegally constructed 10-storey building in Mumbai's Pydhonie region. The arrangements for demolition of the building, which has 88 flats and 18 shops, at Ibrahim Rahimtulla Marg on Masjid Street in Bhendi Bazaar have started. This comes days after BMC started demolishing the illegally-built Gulistan Apartments.

349.title: 5 people attack constable after argument over parking issue in Pune
349.article_body: Five people were booked for allegedly attacking a police constable over a parking issue in Pune. The incident occurred when one of the accused and the constable got into a heated argument after the former asked the constable to remove his parked car so that he could park his two-wheeler. The accused attacked constable with paver blocks, officials said.
