350.title: Pizza Hut now has pizzas starting at ₹79* only
350.article_body: Pizza Hut announced it's giving everyone the perfect reason to say "Shut Up and Take My Money" with its new Flavour Fun range of 12 pizzas starting at ₹79* only. Targeted at Gen Z who’re on a budget, this range has 5 craveable sauces and multiple veg and non-veg toppings, available at 700+ Pizza Hut restaurants and app, it added.

351.title: President Droupadi Murmu shares pics from Queen Elizabeth's funeral
351.article_body: President Droupadi Murmu attended the state funeral of Queen Elizabeth II at Westminster Abbey, London, on Monday. The President of India's official Twitter account shared photos from the event. President Murmu, who was on a three-day visit to the UK, also met Bangladesh's Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina and President of Tanzania Samia Suluhu Hassan as she attended the Queen's funeral.

352.title: Farmer dies by suicide in Pune, leaves note urging PM to ensure MSP
352.article_body: A 42-year-old farmer allegedly died by suicide in Pune's Junnar tehsil over not getting the Minimum Support Price (MSP), police said. The deceased left behind a note purportedly urging PM Narendra Modi to ensure guaranteed MSP for crops. "The farmer had grown onions...the crop failed to fetch a satisfactory price, he stored the produce worth ₹1.5-2 lakh," police added.

353.title: 24-yr-old man killed, 1 injured after speeding car hits bike in Chandigarh
353.article_body: A 24-year-old man was killed and another man was injured after a speeding car hit the motorcycle they were travelling on in Chandigarh. The incident took place on Sunday. Reports said that the deceased was riding pillion on the motorcycle. The investigators said that they have not been able to identify the car that hit the motorcycle.

354.title: 6 children killed after Myanmar army helicopters fire on school: Reports
354.article_body: At least six children were killed and 17 others were wounded after army helicopters shot at a school in northcentral Myanmar, local media and residents said on Monday. The military said it opened fire because rebels were using the building to attack its forces. Myanmar has been gripped by violence since the military overthrew the civilian government in February 2021.

355.title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai visits Indian Embassy in the US, envoy shares pics
355.article_body: Google CEO Sundar Pichai recently visited the Indian Embassy in US, where he held discussions with Indian envoy Taranjit Singh Sandhu. Sharing pictures on Twitter, Sandhu wrote, "Delighted to receive...Pichai...at the Embassy today. Exchanged thoughts on expanding India-US commercial, knowledge & tech partnership." Pichai is reportedly the first Indian-American tech CEO to visit the embassy.

356.title: Ambulance hits bike, runs over 2 pedestrians in Ghaziabad; 3 dead
356.article_body: Three people have died after a speeding ambulance allegedly hit a bike on which a woman was travelling with her son and grandson and then ran over two pedestrians who approached the ambulance to help them in Ghaziabad. The deceased include the two pedestrians and the woman. The ambulance driver was reportedly in an inebriated state.

357.title: Delhi Police head constable shoots self dead inside police station
357.article_body: A 47-year-old Delhi Police head constable died by suicide inside the Prasad Nagar Police Station on Monday morning, police said. The deceased, a warrant branch in-charge, shot himself with a service pistol, police added. The head constable had held a video call with his family before he took the step, police further said.

358.title: Princess Charlotte tells brother George to bow as Queen's coffin passes by; video viral
358.article_body: A video showing Princess Charlotte telling her elder brother Prince George, who is second-in-line to the throne, that he has to bow as Queen's coffin passes by has gone viral on social media. Charlotte, 7, and George, 9, attended the funeral services at both Westminster Abbey and St George's chapel in Windsor with their family.

359.title: COO of US-based Beyond Meat bites a man's nose after fight in garage; arrested
359.article_body: The COO of a plant-based meat company in the US was arrested after he allegedly bit a man's nose during an incident of road rage on Saturday. Beyond Meat's COO, Doug Ramsey, got into a quarrel in a parking garage in Arkansas following a college football game and "ripped" the driver's tip of the nose and "threatened to kill him".

360.title: Mark Zuckerberg loses $71 billion this year, drops 14 spots in world's richest list
360.article_body: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg has seen his fortune halve by $71 billion so far this year to $55.9 billion. The 38-year-old has dropped 14 spots in list of world's richest people to 20th position, his lowest since 2014. Notably, Zuckerberg was world's third-richest person in July 2021 and his wealth swelled to a peak of $142 billion in September 2021.

361.title: Bengaluru reports 140 new COVID-19 cases, no deaths
361.article_body: Bengaluru reported 140 new COVID-19 infections on Monday, taking the cumulative total to 18,70,254 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said. No new deaths were reported, so the overall toll remained at 16,987 in the city. The number of active cases was 2,410, while the infection positivity rate stood at 1.69%.

362.title: 5-yr-old forced to return peacock feathers from Hyd park, mom writes letter
362.article_body: The mother of a five-year-old boy, who was made to return peacock feathers that he had collected from Hyderabad's KBR National Park, wrote a letter to Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao. "This letter from the mother of a young child was touching...I request KBR park authorities to make an exemption only...for kids when they are carrying feathers," Rao said.

363.title: I'd lose cool, had to try to be mom, dad: Rahul on parenting after wife's death
363.article_body: Actor Rahul Dev, while talking about raising his son after his wife's death, said that there were times when he'd lose his cool. "I had to try to be both mom and dad...It's very painful...It looks easy in films, so many times films show that someone became a widower. But starting again is not easy at all," he added.

364.title: Queen Elizabeth II buried at Windsor Castle in UK
364.article_body: Britain's longest-serving monarch, Queen Elizabeth II, was on Monday buried at King George VI Memorial Chapel in Windsor Castle in Berkshire, in a private family burial. Her remains were brought to her final resting place from Westminster Abbey in London after a state funeral. The Queen has been interred next to her family including her late husband Prince Philip.

365.title: 3 Iranian cargo planes to be added to export violation list: US
365.article_body: Three Boeing 747 planes operated by Iranian carriers will be added by the US Commerce Department to the list of planes suspected of violating its export controls. The department said it believes the planes are being used to provide cargo services to Russia. The export controls are part of US sanctions imposed against Russia for invading Ukraine, the department added.

366.title: May pull out of ruling NPP-led alliance in Meghalaya: BJP leader
366.article_body: Senior BJP leader Alexander L Hek said the party may withdraw support from the NPP-led alliance running the Meghalaya government soon. "Everything would be disclosed and explained...at an appropriate time," said Hek about the reasons behind the move. Reports claim the BJP is miffed after its state Vice President Bernard N Marak was arrested for allegedly running a brothel.

367.title: Forces in Karnataka using it as communal laboratory: Kerala CM
367.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan said certain forces in Karnataka were turning it into a "communal laboratory". "There have been a lot of efforts to saffronise the next generation and textbooks are being used as a tool," said Vijayan. He added that "minority communalism cannot defeat majoritarian communalism" and only a "people's movement can bring down this divide".

368.title: Lloris 9th senior French player to be injured ahead of Nations League games
368.article_body: Captain Hugo Lloris and defender Theo Hernandez are injured ahead of France's Nations League games against Austria and Denmark. Hernandez has a torn right adductor while Lloris suffered a right thigh injury, becoming the eighth and ninth senior French players to be injured. Goalkeeper Alban Lafont and Lucas Digne have been called in as replacements for the injured duo.

369.title: FIFA President Infantino might visit India in Oct and meet PM Modi: Reports
369.article_body: FIFA President Gianni Infantino might visit India in October and call on PM Narendra Modi to discuss the way forward for Indian football, as per reports. Infantino's visit might coincide with final leg of the FIFA Women's U-17 World Cup to be held in India. An AIFF statement said if the meeting takes place, then "path-breaking" announcements can be expected.

370.title: Pakistan launch jersey for T20 World Cup 2022, share pics
370.article_body: Pakistan on Monday launched their jersey for T20 World Cup 2022. The kit features different shades of green colour, with yellow stripes being added to the shirt as a new design. The logo of the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) can be seen printed on the top left side of the jersey. The PCB has named the jersey 'Thunder Jersey'.

371.title: Steve Smith one of the best players to ever play the game: Finch
371.article_body: Australia's T20 skipper Aaron Finch said that batter Steve Smith is "one of the best players that has ever played the game over all formats of the game". "We know the quality that Steve's got...So we know the skill that he has got and the game sense and the tactical nous that he has got," Finch said.

372.title: Man Utd launch probe after 12 players, staff fell ill on same day: Reports
372.article_body: Manchester United have reportedly launched an investigation after 12 of their first-team players and staff fell ill on the same day. Reports say club members fell ill with suspected food poisoning following their 2-0 away victory over FC Sheriff in the Europa League. The club is investigating if it was something they ate in Moldova or on the plane back.

373.title: Why can't I associate with RSS? Is it banned?: Kerala Governor Khan
373.article_body: Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan asked why he cannot have relations with the RSS, an outfit he has been associated with since 1986. "Is RSS a banned organisation?" asked Khan, stating it supported him in the Shah Bano case. Khan had met RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat, inviting criticism from the CPI(M) which said the Governor was doing the RSS' bidding.

374.title: 2 tigers found dead in Madhya Pradesh; carcass, hide recovered
374.article_body: As many as two tigers were lost in Madhya Pradesh. According to the officials, a carcass and a hide have been found in Bandhavgarh and Kanha reserves, respectively. The hide of a one-and-half-year-old tiger was recovered from Baihar forest adjoining Kanha Tiger Reserve while the carcass of an 11-year-old tigress was found in the Ghoda Deman area of BTR.

375.title: Sunil Chhetri shares pic with wife and trophies after Durand Cup victory
375.article_body: Bengaluru FC captain Sunil Chhetri took to Twitter to share picture with his wife Sonam Bhattacherjee and trophies after winning Durand Cup. Saying that he wanted to win the tournament with Bengaluru, he wrote, "Durand Cup Champions...would have been a shame if an Army kid playing football professionally never had the chance to say this."

376.title: Secondary market ticket rate for Federer's last tournament jumps to ₹50 lakh: Reports
376.article_body: The secondary market ticket rate for Roger Federer's last tournament, Laver Cup, has risen to £59,000 (more than ₹50 lakh), The Sunday Times reported. "This is people re-selling their tickets, trying to make money off of Roger's retirement & the presence of the Big 4," a fan tweeted. However, Federer's participation at the marquee event is still doubtful.

377.title: Temple showing UP CM as Lord Ram incarnate built near Ayodhya
377.article_body: A temple has been built for CM Yogi Adityanath in UP's Maurya ka Purwa village, which is 15 km from Ayodhya, showcasing him as an "incarnation of Lord Ram". "Yogi Adityanath built the Ram temple for us and I have built this temple for him," said the temple's maker and pujari. He added that an 'aarti' is performed every evening.

378.title: Why was a stick broken and placed on Queen Elizabeth's coffin?
378.article_body: A thin, white stick was broken by the senior-most official of the royal household and placed on Queen Elizabeth's coffin before it was lowered into the royal vault. The 'Wand of Office' is a ceremonial tool of the Lord Chamberlain, once used to 'discipline' people in the monarch's court. Its breaking signifies the end of his service to the monarch.

379.title: Bharat Jodo Yatra's usefulness for Rahul can't be denied: Pawar
379.article_body: NCP President Sharad Pawar said that he couldn't deny the "usefulness" of the Bharat Jodo Yatra for Rahul Gandhi and the Congress party. Pawar said that foot marches like the Yatra have a political impact. He added that he wasn't opposed to Congress' inclusion in Opposition unity for the 2024 elections if it were to take shape.

380.title: UK's think tank launches world's 1st public database on fossil fuels
380.article_body: UK-based nonprofit think tank Carbon Tracker and Global Energy Monitor have launched the world’s first database for tracking the world's fossil fuel production, reserves and emissions. The database, named the Global Registry of Fossils Fuels, reportedly includes data from more than 50,000 oil, gas and coal fields in 89 countries, covering 75% of global reserves, production and emissions.

381.title: If BCCI Prez is endorsing fantasy leagues, you can’t expect players not to do it: Gambhir
381.article_body: Ex-India opener Gautam Gambhir said if BCCI President is endorsing fantasy leagues, one can't expect players not to do it. "If he says that no one should be allowed to do it, I think everyone should follow that...It has to come from the top," he added. "Either we should ban this completely in India. It can’t be statewise," Gambhir stated.

382.title: Great start to the series: Mandhana after India's win vs England in 1st ODI
382.article_body: Following India Women's seven-wicket win against England Women in first ODI, India opener Smriti Mandhana tweeted, "Great start to the ODI series. Let's keep the momentum going. A total team effort." She added, "Great job Jhulan Goswami, Yastika Bhatia, Harmanpreet Kaur and Deepti Sharma." Mandhana was adjudged 'Player of the Match' for her 91 runs off 99 balls.

383.title: He has experienced that all around world already: Finch on Tim David
383.article_body: Australian skipper Aaron Finch commented on batter Tim David who is likely to make his debut in the series against India starting on Tuesday. "Being an overseas player [in franchise cricket] has its challenges...because the expectations are high...So the fact that Tim has experienced that all around the world already...that prepares you as well...for international cricket," Finch said.

384.title: 3 men arrested for gang rape and murder of tribal woman in Andhra
384.article_body: In Andhra Pradesh, three men were arrested for the gang rape and murder of a 46-year-old tribal woman, who was an ASHA worker. The three accused men, identified as Anji, Chinna Anji and Paiswamy, had promised to help the woman locate her missing phone. Palnadu SP Ravi Sankara Reddy said that the men were inebriated and raped the woman.

385.title: 2 drown amid heavy rains in Nainital district
385.article_body: Two individuals died after drowning in separate incidents amid heavy rains in Uttarakhand's Nainital district over the past 24 hours, news agency PTI reported on Monday. One of the individuals reportedly drowned while crossing a flooded stream near Haldwani. Another drowning victim was identified as a boatman who died after falling into a lake on Sunday, as per PTI.

386.title: Ex-SP MLA Kishore Samrite held for threatening to bomb Parliament
386.article_body: Kishore Samrite, a former Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA from Madhya Pradesh's Lanji Assembly constituency, was arrested by Delhi Police's Crime Branch for allegedly threatening to blow up the Parliament with a bomb. Police said Samrite had sent a package to the Parliament, containing a letter, some flags, a copy of the Constitution and some gelatin sticks.

387.title: Farhan planned to bring SRK, Big B, Ranveer together in Don 3: Report
387.article_body: Farhan Akhtar reportedly planned to bring Shah Rukh Khan, Amitabh Bachchan and Ranveer Singh together for the film 'Don 3'. A source stated Ranveer was to have a cameo in the film. "The idea was that SRK's Don character would pass the baton to Ranveer...so that he can take on the iconic role in the future parts," the source added.

388.title: India, Saudi Arabia discuss Rupee-Riyal trade, introduction of UPI system
388.article_body: During the visit of Commerce and Industry Minister Piyush Goyal to Riyadh, the two countries held discussions on the feasibility of institutionalising Rupee-Riyal trade and introducing UPI and Rupay cards in Saudi Arabia. The Commerce Ministry said that the two countries also discussed the removal of trade barriers. Goyal and Prince Abdulaziz bin Salman Al Saud also discussed other issues.

389.title: Best way to keep them quiet is to keep working hard: Dulquer on trolls
389.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan opened up about how he deals with trolls and said that the best way to keep them quiet is to keep working hard. "But there are days when it's hurtful and days when it affects you but like any of us, we cannot dwell on it for too long, we keep on moving forward," Dulquer further said.

390.title: PM Modi congratulates wrestlers Vinesh, Bajrang on World C'ships bronze medals
390.article_body: PM Narendra Modi took to Twitter to congratulate wrestlers Vinesh Phogat and Bajrang Punia on winning bronze medals at World Wrestling Championships 2022 and wrote, "Our wrestlers make us proud." He added, "This is special for both as Vinesh becomes the first Indian woman to win two medals on this platform and Bajrang wins his fourth medal."

391.title: I don't believe PM Modi is misusing CBI, ED: Mamata Banerjee
391.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said that she does not believe that PM Narendra Modi is misusing central agencies such as the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) and the Enforcement Directorate (ED). She alleged that "some BJP leaders are doing this for their interests". A resolution was passed in the state Assembly against the alleged excessive interference of central agencies.

392.title: The film is all about love which is beyond one's life: Jackie on 'Atithi...'
392.article_body: Veteran actor Jackie Shroff, speaking about his upcoming movie 'Atithi Bhooto Bhava', said, "The film is all about love which is beyond one's life." He added that the feeling of love has been expressed in a beautiful and sensitive way in the film. Directed by Hardik Gajjar, 'Atithi Bhooto Bhava' will also feature Pratik Gandhi and Sharmin Segal.

393.title: MoS Defence Ajay Bhatt visits Palampur military station
393.article_body: Union Minister of State for Defence Ajay Bhatt visited the Palampur military station in Himachal Pradesh on Monday where he interacted with personnel of the Indian Army's Dah Division, officials said. The minister was briefed on operational preparedness, PRO (Defence) Jammu informed. Bhatt was also briefed on various innovations by units of the Dah Division, the official added.

394.title: Fraudster abused me when I told him I was in 'Jamtara': Amit Sial
394.article_body: Actor Amit Sial revealed that his mother was almost scammed after a fraudster asked her for a "UPI number" over an airline refund. Amit further stated, "I took the phone...I asked him if he had seen 'Jamtara', he said yes, I told him I have acted in it." He said the fraudster then abused him and disconnected the call.

395.title: I'm over 'who wore it better' collages: Janhvi on equation with Sara, Ananya
395.article_body: Janhvi Kapoor, speaking about her equation with her contemporaries Ananya Panday, Sara Ali Khan and Tara Sutaria, said it's one of mutual respect. "At this point, we are just over...stupid 'who wore it better' collages, or...who's doing what," she added. Janhvi further said though there's "an element of insecurity" in all of them, they're very confident about their individual personalities.

396.title: Ukrainian shelling kills 13 in Donetsk, Pro-Russia officials say
396.article_body: At least 13 civilians were killed in shelling by Ukrainian forces in the city of Donetsk, its pro-Russia authorities claimed on Monday. "The number of people injured is being determined," the city's Moscow-backed mayor stated. Donetsk city is the administrative centre of Ukraine's breakaway Donetsk region. The region has been partially under the control of Moscow-backed separatists since 2014.

397.title: Want to entertain fans once again with batting: Gujarat Giants skipper Sehwag
397.article_body: Talking about playing in Legends League Cricket, Gujarat Giants skipper Virender Sehwag said he would try to entertain his fans once again with his batting after getting an opportunity to return to the cricketing field. "And I hope our team keeps playing well...wins the trophy," he added. Legends League Cricket is a global league with ex-cricketers playing competitive cricket.

398.title: Not 1 type of weaponry bought for defence forces under UPA: Amarinder Singh
398.article_body: Former Punjab Chief Minister Captain Amarinder Singh on Monday said "not even one type of weapon was ever purchased for Army, Navy or Air Force" under UPA government. "Now, weaponry is coming, which is necessary for us if we are to secure our nation," Singh said. He added that Congress is responsible for China being ahead of India in weaponry.

399.title: PM Modi to address meeting of all BJP mayors tomorrow
399.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will address a meeting of all BJP mayors at 10.30 am on Tuesday. "With growing urbanisation, it is important that we view it as an opportunity and work together towards building modern [and] futuristic cities," he said. PM Modi will virtually inaugurate the National Mayors' Conference on Tuesday morning in Gujarat's Gandhinagar.

400.title: 3 workers die after inhaling toxic gas inside illegal Assam coal mine
400.article_body: Three workers of an illegal coal mine located in Lido in Assam's Tinsukia district died on Sunday night after allegedly inhaling toxic gas, police said. So far, five persons have been arrested following the incident, according to police. "The 'rat hole' mine was being run illegally on a hill top," Tinsukia SP Debojit Deuri said.

401.title: Couple found hanging in a forest in Odisha's Kandhamal
401.article_body: A 45-year-old man and his wife were found hanging from separate trees in a forest in Odisha's Kandhamal district on Monday. The deceased, Monoranjan Nayak and Smitanjali, were residents of nearby Paburia village and might have died by suicide over some family dispute, police said. Notably, Nayak and his wife worked as Gaon Sathi and ASHA worker respectively.

402.title: Entry of devotees into sanctum sanctorum in Kedarnath Temple banned
402.article_body: The entry of devotees into the sanctum sanctorum of Kedarnath Temple in Uttarakhand has been banned for the time being in view of a huge rush of pilgrims. Devotees cannot go beyond the 'sabha mandap' for darshan till the ban is in force, Shri Badarinath Kedarnath Temple Committee said. The restriction can be removed only when the crowd gets smaller.

403.title: SBI asks exporters to trade with Bangladesh in rupee, taka: Report
403.article_body: The State Bank of India (SBI) asked exporters to avoid trading with Bangladesh using the dollar and instead use rupee or taka, Reuters reported. SBI is looking to protect Bangladesh's declining foreign reserves which have fallen from $48 billion a year earlier to $37 billion. Bangladesh Commerce Minister Tipu Munshi had said they want to cut dependency on the dollar.

404.title: Himachal to spend ₹3 crore to build quarters for govt employees: CM Thakur
404.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said that the state government will spend ₹3 crore to build residential accommodations for Class III and IV employees in the state's Kangra district. "The state government has cleared and fulfilled various dues and demands of the government officers," CM Thakur said. He added that the government is committed towards the welfare of its employees.
